text: Choi Yun-chil (July 19, 1928 - October 8, 2020) was a South Korean long- distance runner. He was a two-time Olympian and a two-time national champion in the marathon. He competed in the 1948 Summer Olympics and at the 1952 Summer Olympics. He was born in Tanchon, present-day North Korea. Choi died on October 8, 2020 in Seoul at the age of 92.'불운의 마라토너' 최윤칠 고문 별세…아시안게임 첫 金 주인공 ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Long- distance runners Category:Olympians for South Korea
title: Choi Yun-chil
